Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; at top, trace of added white outline of lotus flower above two white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of foreleg of lion on the hind leg (with added red patch) of goat, to right; part of elaborate rosette and rising roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Deer and goats rarely feature on vessels in the Mature Animal Style. The presence of interior decoration, however, suggests that this sherd is slightly later than vases in the Wild Goat Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 259, no. 475, pl. 65)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0507) (phase 2)
